page.title: 13HOUSING IN SHIELDAIG
page.content: BECAUSE OF THE SCENIC BEAUTY AND MILD CLIMATE OF THIS PART OF SCOTLAND SHIELDAIG HAS BECOME RATHER A FRAGMENTED VILLAGE WITH MANY HOUSES BOUGHT AND USED ONLY AT HOLIDAY TIMES. ALMOST ONE THIRD OF THE DWELLINGS ARE UNOCCUPIED IN THE WINTER MONTHS. SOME OF THESE HOUSES BELONG TO FAMILIES WHO HAVE MOVED AWAY BUT STILL FEEL THEIR ROOTS BELONG IN THE HIGHLANDS. AS THE COUNCIL HAS BUILT A DOZEN NEW HOUSES, YOUNG MARRIED COUPLES HAVE NOT FOUND IT SO HARD TO RENT ACCOMODATION. MOST OF THE HOUSES WHICH ARE STRUNG ALONG THE SHORE FRONT HAVE BEEN PAINTED WHITE WHICH GIVES THE VILLAGE A FRESH CLEAN APPEARANCE. JUDGING BY THE NUMBERS OF CAMERAS WE SEE, THIS MUST BE ONE OF THE MOST PHOTOGRAPHED VILLAGES IN BRITAIN.
